**Developer Guide: Dress for the Weather**  
This app provides personalized outfit recommendations based on the user’s location as well as the current and forecasted weather conditions. It was built with Python, with Streamlit, and OpenAI. OpenMeteo was used for the weather data. Plotly was used for the graphs. 

**User Interaction/ Walk through**  
The user enters a location, weather is fetched from OpenMeteo, and passed to OpenAI for outfit suggestions, RUNTHIS.py is used.  
![][image1]  
User starts Streamlit app using command “streamlit run RUNTHIS.py”  
![][image2]![][image3]  
Streamlit opens Dress for the Weather in the browser. The user inputs their location and receives current weather conditions and a graph of the daily forecast.   
![][image4]![][image5]  
The user chooses an activity from the list and receives an outfit that is appropriate for the weather and their activity. 

**Issues:**   
There are no known bugs or major issues present.  
		 	 	 		  
**Final Specifications implemented:**

- Streamlit  
- OpenMeteo weather data  
- Plotly graphs  
- OpenAI generated outfits

**Future work:** 

- I did not get to integrate the feature that shows sample photos of the outfits. I ran into some trouble getting OpenAI to work for my project which took up some valuable time.  
- Creating a feature that allows users to input their own activity (not from the list).  
- Adding a multiple day forecast.
